responsibilities: Built end-to-end features for DISCO’s legaltech web platform, integrating ingestion services with React-based document review and timeline tools.
Developed APIs and pipelines for AI Timelines and Cecilia AI doc summaries, enabling interactive case insights in the frontend.
Integrated vLex legal data library into case review dashboards, giving users seamless access to statutes and case law.

Developed enhancements to the document list UI: implemented dynamic custom columns (e.g. exhibit set, tag, status), light/dark mode toggle, and improved rendering of images/PDFs (zoom, rotate) to improve reviewer usability.
Developed 10+ new application features and distributed services that support high-scale applications. Helped evolve front-end and back-end stack.
Worked on the Decision Manager dashboard: built features allowing merchants to define business rules via visual interfaces, filter transactions by geolocation, order velocity.
Delivered merchant risk dashboards that allowed clients to visualize fraud alerts and transaction anomalies in real time.
Owned features in merchant dashboard for payments and fraud reporting: building UI panels for risk alerts, transaction summaries, filtering/search of transaction data, error logs.

Developed analytics panels that compare real-time and historical data across dimensions (processor, currency, payment channel etc.), with event-triggered alerts when metrics deviate (e.g., spike in declines, unusual reason codes).
Extended REST APIs and backend services for Risk Management feature updates, supporting payer authentication and enhanced reporting.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

rules: Preserve original facts/achievements but prioritize adapting relevant technologies/frameworks extensively to match the JD.
Keep some bullets close to the original wording, but modify others (like adding specific tech stack or terms) to emphasize the required tech stack and skills.
Make a sentences detailed and high-aligned with job description. Avoid generic or vague statements and duplications or restates
Use action verbs (e.g., built, designed, optimized, delivered) and high-level tech terms (e.g., APIs, microservices, dashboards, data pipelines, CI/CD).
